intro: Phrodus breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered phrodus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Phrodus breviflorus is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas.
